snippet: A scandal in Germany flared anew when the country’s biggest newspaper confirmed that President Christian Wulff had made a menacing telephone call to its editor in an effort to snuff out a damaging story.
abstract: Scandal in Germany flares anew when country’s biggest newspaper, Bild, confirms that President Christian Wulff, an important ally of German Chancellor Angela Merkel, had made a menacing telephone call to its editor in an effort to snuff out a story about an unusual personal loan Wulff had received from the family of a German entrepreneur.
lead_paragraph: A scandal in Germany flared anew when the country’s biggest newspaper confirmed that President Christian Wulff had made a menacing telephone call to its editor in an effort to snuff out a damaging story.

headline.seo: German President’s Call to Paper Reignites Scandal Over Loan
headline.main: German President’s Call to Paper Reignites Scandal Over Loan
headline.print_headline: German Newspaper Says It Got Menacing Call From President
